intro: Helicostylis scabra, commonly known as the rough-stemmed helicostylis, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, rough-textured stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating. Its flowers are clustered in spadices, a typical feature of the Araceae family, and are usually green or brown in color. Helicostylis scabra is often used in water gardens and as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to wet environments.
